events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle on the main street during rush hour.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the vehicle collision described.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation and follow up with the customer.
Official acknowledgment of the claim has been sent to the customer along with initial instructions for next steps.
The insurance company requested vehicle registration, photos of the damage, and police accident report for verification.
All requested documents, including photos and official accident report, were submitted by the customer promptly.
The claims investigation team began analyzing the submitted evidence and contacted the involved parties for statements.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damage estimate was confirmed by the assessor.
A settlement amount covering the full repair costs was proposed to the customer in line with the policy coverage.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the timely response.
The claim was officially approved by senior management following the positive investigation and customer agreement.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and transferred to the customer’s designated bank account.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation of payment receipt and customer’s final acceptance.
